<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Keep Up Appearances](/Feats.aspx?ID=943) <actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Human" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=90" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Character Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=12) pg. 12 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Access**
Taldan nationality

**Trigger**
You are affected by an [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60) effect.

</column>

---

Taldan pride means you never show weakness. Roll a [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) check and compare the result to any observing creatures’ Perception DCs. On a success, that creature believes you were unaffected by the emotion effect. A creature tricked in this manner can’t benefit from the emotion effect and can’t use abilities that require you to be under this emotion effect; for example, if you successfully use this ability to trick a [will-o’-wisp](/Monsters.aspx?ID=414) into believing you aren’t under a [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68) effect, it can’t use its Feed on Fear ability on you.
name: Keep Up Appearances
